page.title: 02EDUCATION VILLAGE SCHOOL
page.content: Our school is over one hundred years old.It is a very small school.The one large room measures 13m39cm by 4m88cm. We have two classes,11 juniors and 10 infants.The bell still exists but we do not use it.Our school dinners come from St.Wilfrid's in Ripon.We attend school from the age of four till eleven, then we transfer to secondary school-Ripon City or Ripon Grammar or Upper Nidderdale or St.Aidan's in Harrogate.We have a playground, about the size of a tennis court and a school garden.There is a Headteacher who teaches the juniors,an assistant who teaches the infants and a part-time teacher who teaches music. There is a dinner lady(who is also the clerical assistant),a cleaner and a non-teaching assistant(who also looks after us at playtimes).
